import React from 'react' import Sidebar from '../../components/sidebar/Sidebar' import Navsection from '../../components/navbar/Navsection' import './introduction.scss' import { useNavigate } from "react-router-dom" const Introduction = () => { // ---------------- const navigate = useNavigate(); const transfer = (txt) => { if (txt.includes(":)")) { setTimeout(() => navigate('/'), 500); } } const submit = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); const code = document.getElementById("input").value; const data = { code: code }; fetch('/codeintroduction', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(data) }) .then(res => res.text()) .then(txt => alert(txt)) .then(txt => transfer(txt)) } return (

Java Introduction

What is Java?

Java is a popular programming language, born in 1995. It is owned by Oracle, and more than 3 billion devices run Java.

It is good at:

  • Mobile applications (especially Android apps)
  • Desktop applications
  • Web applications
  • Games
  • Database connection

The advantages of Java:

  • Java works on all kinds of platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, Raspberry Pi, etc.)
  • It is one of the most used programming languages among the developers
  • Compared with other languages, it is easier to learn and simpler to use
  • It is open-source and free
  • It is secure, fast and strong
  • It has a large community support
  • Java is an object-oriented language which show the program structure clearly and support the code to be reused, lowering costs

Exercise:

Please try to output this "A Java Tutor" by using the basic Syntax (System.out.println())
